explanation: The report is correct. strncpy(dest, src, n) may read up to n bytes from src (stopping early only if a NUL is encountered). In the posted code there is no proof that record->name_entry points to an object that contains a NUL within the first sizeof(task_prop->name)-1 bytes or that the source object is at least that large. If the source object is smaller or lacks a NUL within those bytes, strncpy can perform an out-of-bounds read of the source, which violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17. (Note: forcing a terminating NUL in the destination after the call does not prevent the potentially out-of-bounds read performed by strncpy.) If there is an external invariant guaranteeing the source buffer size or NUL placement, the call could be safe, but no such guarantee is visible in the provided code, so the reported violation stands.
